blog.name: we-are-rogue
blog.title: we are Rogue
blog.description:
Gallery | D&D | Fiction | Theory | Practice | Iconic | Tags and Masterposts

Inspiration and resources for Rogues, the most resourceful player class and fantasy archetype of them all.

Jacks of all trades and masters of none, thieves, outlaws, rascals, scoundrels, pickpockets, cutpurses, cat burglars, bandits, con artists, assassins, infiltrators, highwaymen, spies, swashbucklers, smugglers, pirates, thugs, jesters, tricksters, skillmonkeys, specialists, factotums, and the occasional ronin: we are ROGUE.

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

summary: Arya glanced furtively across the room, worried that Septa Mordane might have read her thoughts, but the septa was paying her no...
body:
You know I often wonder if Arya would have been a bit more confident about herself, had Septa Mordane treated her with a bit of kindness and patience. After all the septa was her tutor and for a child to constantly hear that she is disappointing from that particular person who is responsible for her education is quite devastating. It’s more concerning when you think about the fact that Arya was constantly compared to her sister and got to hear stuff like “Arya has the hands of a blacksmith.” I think these kind of statements not only lowered her self confidence but also made her dread the septa a bit. Like take this quote for example:

Arya glanced furtively across the room, worried that Septa Mordane might have read her thoughts, but the septa was paying her no attention today.

It struck me odd that Arya should be “worried” about the Septa reading her thoughts. She was in fact thinking about how her stitches were crooked again ( unlike her sister’s) and what the septa had said about her earlier. But the thing is why did Arya have to worry about hiding these thoughts from the septa? It looked like as if she was afraid of the consequences of the septa finding out about them. And in my opinion it’s not natural!! It’s not natural at all for a child to be so on guard about what she is thinking or about how she is feeling. Also I noticed another thing. Arya was very observant about how Mordane treated her peers or rather the way she gushed over them. I don’t think Arya ever got any kind of positive feedback from the Septa, so it makes sense that she would keep note of how the other girls were treated. For example:

…She was sitting with the Princess Myrcella, all smiles and admiration. It was not often that the septa was privileged to instruct a royal princess in the womanly arts, as she had said when the queen brought Myrcella to join them. Arya thought that Myrcella’s stitches looked a little crooked too, but you would never know it from the way Septa Mordane was cooing.

This might have been a quite strange sight for Arya: Her Septa “cooing” over crooked stitches. I am saying this because time and time again she was made to feel like as if she was the personification of failure for lacking finesse in “womanly arts”.

I don’t know why I am talking about this again but I have always found Arya’s inner monologues to show a lack of self confidence and I think the cause of this is embedded in how she was made to perceive herself when she was younger. With every reread I come across these little pin points of plot which show how hurt sometimes Arya would be. How she would cry and run away only to get dismissed as an unruly child whose behaviour needed to be reported to her mother.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: so now that i’ve just finished arya’s last ACoK chapter i’m like so mad at the show for so many reasons? like the show frames...
body: so now that i’ve just finished arya’s last ACoK chapter i’m like so mad at the show for so many reasons? like the show frames arya’s escape from harrenhal so differently than it actually goes down in the books? like in the show arya is pretty clever getting jaqen to help her but in the book jaqen is fuckin gone now and she’s literally driven by the fear of being ruled over by vargo hoat and she has to round up gendry and hot pie who are still under with her for throwing off the hierarchal balance of harrenhal in the first place and are very hesitant to do much else and she has to get horses, sneak around past guards with the horses and eventually kills the guard at their exit with the little coin trick that they shove into the show after the red wedding. like idk i’m upset bc arya was so scarily independent in this part and the show gives us none of that

blog.name: ao3feed-jonrya
blog.title: AO3feed-Jonrya
blog.description: An automated feed for Jon x Arya fics posted on AO3.

title: We are not them
description:
by LittleRedRidingHood

often people say Arya is just like Lyanna and Sansa is just like her mother, however they both went through so much that I don’t think that is entirely true anymore. Jon and Arya have both lost themselves and as for Elia, well she is a bit of a creation of my own.

Words: 2186, Chapters: 3/3, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Arya, sansa, Elia, Lyanna - Character, Elia Martell, catelyn, Jon Snow, Edric “Ned” Dayne, Tyrion
  • Relationships: Arya Stark/Jon Snow, Edric Dayne/Elia Sand, Tyrion Lannister/Sansa Stark

True wolf from Winterfell 

and I can’t wait when she and Dany will meet each other.

Arya lived in Braavos and maybe she knows many things about her. Arya and Dany had a life like each other. and they both lived in Braavos  too. 

I am desperately waiting their reunion

blog.description: Kat, 17, she/they. Respect Carol Danvers and Arya Stark or die by my battleaxe
